title.narrative: Resiliency in the Limpopo River Basin (RESILIM)

description.narrative: (USAID Southern Africa Regional): Resilience in the Limpopo Basin (RESILIM) project seeks to improve transboundary water and natural resource management for improved resilience of communities and ecosystems. FY14 funding will build upon risk and vulnerability mapping and hotspot analysis through implementing pilot activities in areas vulnerable to climate change. RESILIM will enhance institutional capacity around resilience building and conserving biodiversity through grants/subcontracts and will continue to foster dialogue among key institutions and decision makers to incorporate these issues into policy making. RESILIM will begin implementing the knowledge management and communication plan ensuring access to information to support related sound decision making. At least 2,000 people will have increased capacity to address climate change impacts and 3,500 ha in biologically significant areas will demonstrate improved biophysical conditions as a result of USAID's assistance.
